posts.post_content:
@2pcsofcandy: perhaps her marks are not glowing because she's finally found a way to get around her dark deal with the demons, or at least one of them? After all, that IS why she's in Innistrad, to hunt down, or find a weapon to kill one of the three demons ruling her. If I'm not mistaken, Griselbrand, the demon who killed Avacyn, is one of the demons Liliana had a pact with. Can anyone confirm this?  
  
Or alternatively, her deal with Nicol Bolas is overriding the demon magic... After all, Bolas is more powerful than the three demons combined. (see novel Test of Metal for more on Liliana's deal with Bolas)

Posted By: RazielKane (10/9/2011 12:26:30 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Seems pretty good, and her cost and initial loyalty resembles [Jace Beleren](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace Beleren). Her plus' and minus' aren't, for better of worse.  
  
I do have to say, however, I like the ultimate ability. You can use it in conjunction with [Liliana Vess](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liliana Vess), make them sacrifice all the creatures (if they choose the right pile) then resurrect them.   
  
I'd say, this is a decent improvement to [Do or Die](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Do or Die). Instead of just creatures, you can target permenants, however, Liliana costs 1 more, and has to take at least 2 more turns after that to use the effect.
posts.html:
Seems pretty good, and her cost and initial loyalty resembles Jace Beleren. Her plus' and minus' aren't, for better of worse.

I do have to say, however, I like the ultimate ability. You can use it in conjunction with Liliana Vess, make them sacrifice all the creatures (if they choose the right pile) then resurrect them.

I'd say, this is a decent improvement to Do or Die. Instead of just creatures, you can target permenants, however, Liliana costs 1 more, and has to take at least 2 more turns after that to use the effect.

Posted By: TherealphatMatt (9/23/2011 5:05:15 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I love her. Drop her on turn 3 and +1 your [Vengeful Pharoah](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vengeful Pharoah) and you've got free removal each turn that she lives, as well as a way to keep their stored cards down. That's some attrition I can live with. She still has her -2 ability in case you absolutely can't deal with one of their creatures, due to Hexproof or whatnot.  
  
And that +6... <3

posts.post_content: Love the card mechanically, will definitely play it, but not sold on the artwork. Her pose is so weird and the tilted perspective seems pretty unnecessary. Also it's really easy to miss the veil here since it's being covered up by that fire in her hand. Why not have her wear the veil when the card's name features it? And why aren't her marks glowing? I thought they were supposed to glow when she casts spells. Presumably the fire in her hands come from a spell.
posts.html:
Love the card mechanically, will definitely play it, but not sold on the artwork. Her pose is so weird and the tilted perspective seems pretty unnecessary. Also it's really easy to miss the veil here since it's being covered up by that fire in her hand. Why not have her wear the veil when the card's name features it? And why aren't her marks glowing? I thought they were supposed to glow when she casts spells. Presumably the fire in her hands come from a spell.
